definition[0]: to be all around someone or something on every side
example[0]: He glared at the people who surrounded the tent.
example[1]: The field was surrounded by trees.
explanation[0]: Surround is often passive in this meaning
definition[1]: if police or soldiers surround a place, they arrange themselves in positions all the way around it
example[2]: Armed police surrounded a house in the High Street.
definition[2]: to be closely related to a situation or event
example[3]: Some of the issues surrounding alcohol abuse are very complex.
example[4]: Silence and secrecy surround the murder.
definition[3]: an area around the edge of something, especially one that is decorated or made of a different material
